{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = |caption2 = |pp = http://www.alfa.com.tw/products_show.php?pc=34&ps=20 |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = |wikipedia = |brand = ALFA Network |model = AWUS036NHA |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = September 17, 2011 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/ALFA_Network_AWUS036NHA |sernum = |wlclass = N150 |series = |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Female Mini-B |formfactor = corded (modular) adapter |vendor_id = 0cf3 |device_id = 9271 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = UQ23668 |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 00:C0:CA |chip1 = Atheros;AR9271; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = RP-SMA |antenna = |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 1 |sstreams = 1 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = AWB |manuf_model = WUS620C-H |manuf_rev = |addchip = 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2576L;SiGe, 2576L, ;1; |flags = high power |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = Yes |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 05/16/2012 |estreldate = |price = |upc = |ean = 4718050300846 |dx_sku = |newegg = 9SIA8UD37Y8211 |asin = B004Y6MIXS |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = Taiwan |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== 1x1:1 SISO The device identifies as an Atheros UB91C. :[https://lists.ath9k.org/pipermail/ath9k-devel/2012-March/008279.html There may be multiple revisions of this device.] The Wi-Fi IC would appear to also vary between newer and older units. :Older devices likely use ''AR9271 (AR9271-AL1A)''.. while newer ones may :use ''AR9271L (AR9271L-AL3A)''. Both are pictured in the images below. :[https://lists.ath9k.org/pipermail/ath9k-devel/2013-August/011987.html 'The L stands for "Low-Cost".', per ''Sujith'' on '''ath9k-devel'''] if it's cheap per sujith it's also Low-power per our tests The power amplifier IC used is a [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=953 [[Skyworks]] (''SiGe'') SE2576L / 2576L]. :[http://www.skyworksinc.com/uploads/documents/202428A.pdf SE2576L Datasheet] The power amplifier connected as follows: * 67 - XPABIAS - (Analog Output) connected with EN(able) pin of external Power Amp. * 68 - PDET - (Analog Input) connected with DET ping of external Power Amp. The LED on this device is '''blue'''. :The FCC ID would appear to only be printed on the label of newer units. ===FCC test results=== * Radiated power (with antenna): 90 dBuV/m peak (802.11b AVG of CH1,CH11) * Output power (before antenna): 10.41 dBm peak (802.11b CH6) (10.99mW) According to FCC test results, this adapter is ~5 times ''weaker'' (sure it's "weaker" just as "L" stands for "Low cost" details: https://github.com/qca/open-ath9k-htc-firmware/issues/82#issuecomment-252649735) :than typical Wi-Fi adapters such as [[TP-LINK TL-WN722N]]. Although it's flagged high-power manufacturer never released driver to support high-power operation. ==Links of Interest== *[https://deviwiki.com/files/datasheets/alfa_network/AWUS036NHA.pdf Datasheet]
[https://deviwiki.com/files/vendors/ALFA%20Network/AWUS036NHA.7z Drivers] *[https://archive.org/details/alfa-network-awus036nha Original drivers (mirror)] ===Reviews=== *[http://hackthistutorials.wordpress.com/2013/01/20/review-alfa-awus036nha/ On '''HACK|THIS blog'''] ===Vendor links=== ====United States==== * [http://store.rokland.com/products/alfa-awus036nha-802-11n-wireless-n-usb-wi-fi-adapter-2-watt On '''Rokland'''] * [http://www.data-alliance.net/servlet/-strse-372/Alfa-AWUS036NH-2000mW-1000mW/Detail On '''data-alliance'''] ====Europe==== * [http://wifi-gratuit.eu/fr/alfa-awus036nha-/115-carte-alfa-awus036nha-1000mw-antenne-5-dbi.html On '''wifi-gratuit.eu'''] * [http://www.eurodk.com/en/products/alfa-wifi-usb/alfa-awus036nha On '''eurodk.com'''] ==Pictures== ===External===

[[Has images::internal| ]] ==Notes== ===operating range=== * 802.11g: 2.182-2.887 GHz [[Category:English Documentation]]
